meanings.definition: The state or quality of being fixed or stable.
meanings.sent1: Her fixedness in her beliefs made it hard to convince her otherwise.
meanings.sent2: The fixedness of the table ensured it wouldn't wobble.
meanings.sent3: The fixedness of the cat staring at the wall was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The fixedness of the mountain against the sky was a striking sight.
meanings.sent5: The fixedness of the rule was as solid as a rock.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unchanging or permanent.
meanings.sent1: The fixedness of the painting's colors remained vibrant over time.
meanings.sent2: His fixedness in his routine never wavered.
meanings.sent3: The fixedness of the clock always being five minutes fast was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The fixedness of the stars in the night sky was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The fixedness of the memory stayed crystal clear in her mind.
